minesweeper.name: Minesweeper
minesweeper.description: Minesweeper is a classic logic based strategy game. As I was learning JavaScript, I thought it would be fun to make one of my favorite classic games using what I was learning. In the process, I learned about the html5 canvas, which is now used instead of flash for web based games and animations. After completing the normal minesweeper, I wanted to add something more advanced to the project. I decided to add animations (inspired by Google' Minesweeper), so I used the html5 canvas API to animate it.

data.text: Minesweeper is a classic logic based strategy game. As I was learning JavaScript, I thought it would be fun to make one of my favorite classic games using what I was learning. In the process, I learned about the html5 canvas, which is now used instead of flash for web based games and animations. After completing the normal minesweeper, I wanted to add something more advanced to the project. I decided to add animations (inspired by Google' Minesweeper), so I used the html5 canvas API to animate it.

items.content: Wanted to learn how to use the HTML5 canvas
Love Minesweeper, so wanted to make my own version
Wanted to learn more javascript and do some more web development
I was comfortable and familiar with html, css, javascript, and the Canvas API
How to approach a problem from different angles (realized that I would need to use the html5 canvas api if I wanted to make animations)
Learned about recursion

pong.name: Pong
pong.description: Keeping with the theme of the previous projects I had just finished, I decided to make a 2 player pong game. This was much more complexed then minesweeper as I needed to update the canvas on key press, as well as slowly increase the ball speed and have collision detection.

data.text: Keeping with the theme of the previous projects I had just finished, I decided to make a 2 player pong game. This was much more complexed then minesweeper as I needed to update the canvas on key press, as well as slowly increase the ball speed and have collision detection.

items.content: Wanted to expand my javascript knowledge
Always thought it would be fun to make pong
Wanted to learn more about the HTML5 canvas API
How to animate multiple objects at a time using canvas
I learned more advanced javascript
How to make a simple UI users could use, and save their options

tetris.name: Tetris
tetris.description: For my last classic game project, I wanted to do something much more complexed. I decided to do Tetris, as it is one of my favorite games, and had a lot of complexed elements. It took much longer then the previous three projects, but was very satisfying to finish.

data.text: For my last classic game project, I wanted to do something much more complexed. I decided to do Tetris, as it is one of my favorite games, and had a lot of complexed elements. It took much longer then the previous three projects, but was very satisfying to finish.

items.content: Wanted to finish of my web game projects with something that was more complicated
Wanted to practice and advance my javascript knowledge
Tetris has guidelines you need to follow if you are going to publish it under the Tetris name, and I thought it would be good practice to make a project with specifications I also needed to meet
Learned how to better mitigate methods and functions to the most relevant class object
I became comfortable and very familiar with javascript
I met most the required guidelines. (Some were too advanced for me at the time, but I plan to come back and update it to meet them)

portfolio-v1.name: Portfolio V1
portfolio-v1.description: I wanted to create a professional and classy website that I could use to display all of the projects I create. I think this is a unique and relevant way to display my projects and works in a way that represents me and what I love doing. I continuously update this as I continue to come up with projects and complete them, as well as work on projects ether for school, or one of the organizations I am a part of.

data.text: I wanted to create a professional and classy website that I could use to display all of the projects I create. I think this is a unique and relevant way to display my projects and works in a way that represents me and what I love doing. I continuously update this as I continue to come up with projects and complete them, as well as work on projects ether for school, or one of the organizations I am a part of.

items.content: I wanted to have a unique way to display all of my projects.
I wanted to display this in a relevant manner to my interests and passions.
I wanted to reflect on what I have learned, and what my takeaways have been.
I was able to create a classy, informative website that is simple yet effective.
I now have a nice way to display and represent my projects in a manner I am proud of.
I learned some really interesting tricks you can do with CSS and HTML5 (such as the flip cards I use for project previews).
The home page/landing page. This has some information about me, and a list of some of my skills.
The project category and organization tabs. These contain previews of my projects, based on what category of computer science they fall under.

The third and final component of the website is the project pages themselves. These pages have information about each project, including: an overview, reasons for and purpose of the project, and the outcome of the project.

portfolio-v2.name: Portfolio V2
portfolio-v2.description: This project is the website you are currently on. It is a replacement for my previous portfolio website, which I had not been keeping up to date. I decided to remake it from scratch using Svelte, TypeScript, and SASS, all of which are awesome frameworks I have wanted to learn for a while.

data.text: This project is the website you are currently on. It is a replacement for my previous portfolio website, which I had not been keeping up to date. I decided to remake it from scratch using Svelte, TypeScript, and SASS, all of which are awesome frameworks I have wanted to learn for a while.

items.content: I wanted to make a portfolio site that was easier to keep up to date and looked professional
I wanted to learn some web technologies I had seen in the past but never got around to looking into
I have a portfolio website that looks professional, is easy to update, and that I can be proud of
I have experience using TypeScript, Svelte, and SASS

torc-character-designer.name: TORC Character Designer
torc-character-designer.description: This is one of my favorite projects. It is an external character creator and outfit designer for Star Wars The Old Republic. I really love this game and the community, and wanted to do something everyone could use and enjoy. It is very complexed, and I had to learn alot of new topics and skills while working on it. Im also very proud of it since it is the first tool of its kind made by anyone, ever, and that required me to solve alot of problems no one else has done  before.

data.text: This is one of my favorite projects. It is an external character creator and outfit designer for Star Wars The Old Republic. I really love this game and the community, and wanted to do something everyone could use and enjoy. It is very complexed, and I had to learn a lot of new topics and skills while working on it. I'm also very proud of it since it is the first tool of its kind made by anyone, ever, and that required me to solve a lot of problems no one else has done  before.

items.content: I wanted to make something truly unique that had not been done before.
This is the only Star Wars The Old Republic external character designer
I also wanted to make something people would not only want to use, but also something that would inspire people, and help them realize what they can do.
I had read comments and posts on a variety of platforms from people requesting/asking about a character viewer/creator, the earliest dating back to around 2014.
I also wanted to expedite the process from re-creating your character outside of the game (for 3D modeling, printing, or just for fun).
The process could take upwards of one to two hour for one character.
With my program, it takes ~20 minutes.
How to read hexadecimal headers
How to read custom file formats
Basics of PHP
Advanced JavaScript
Better code organization
Better planning strategies
How to break down problems into achievable sections
How to effectively troubleshoot issues and debug
Sometimes the best solution is to take a break and work on different part/something else for a while
How to use the THREE.js library
Basics of 3D design/modeling
HLSL
GLSL
The graphics pipeline (how 3D models are shaded and rendered)
How models, textures, lighting and shadows work
Users can download a .zip with all the necessary info to re-create their character in blender
Has all character creator options that the game has
Customization sliders
Gender
Classes
Species
Allows changing of light-color gradient
Users can search by keywords to get a list of every related item, which they can then select from to display one
Users can add a global dye to their outfit
Users can share their creations using the sharing url button at the bottom
Fixed many broken items (only a few left still needing to be fixed)
Fixed a few edge cases where things like hoods would render on Togrutas and Twi'leks
Fixed an issue where exporting the zip had no file extension on Firefox
Fixed long loading times
Now has dark side corruption
Added Eye Cube Maps (the glossy reflection on the character's eyes)
Changed the lighting to be closer to the preview window
Added a Unify Colors option for each armor slot (this makes the slot in question become the same color as the chest slot)
Added ability to apply dyes for each slot
Added tick marks to make it easier to tell where to click to move the slider to a specific value
Re-arranged the order of a few customizations to match in-game numbering
Updated many of the UI images to make them clearer
Now have a randomize button, and it also randomizes the slider values on load.
Tweaked a bunch of the rendering settings (camera position, lighting angle, lighting intensity, etc.)

torc-npc-viewers.name: TORC NPC 3D Viewers
torc-npc-viewers.description: This project came about as a natural continuation of the TORCommunity Character Designer. It is a 3D viewer for loading the models for different NPC (non player characters) from Star Wars: The Old Republic. It uses a very similar process to the character designer for loading the models, but this time has to take a dynamic input specified on page load.

data.text: This project came about as a natural continuation of the TORCommunity Character Designer. It is a 3D viewer for loading the models for different NPC (non player characters) from Star Wars: The Old Republic. It uses a very similar process to the character designer for loading the models, but this time has to take a dynamic input specified on page load.

items.content: Natural continuation of my previous project, the Character Designer
Was a request feature for the TORCommunity website
One of the other fan sites, JediPedia, had a similar feature that was never flushed out
Wanted to refine my methods for loading and rendering models
I know how to load models more efficiently
The rendering process I use in a variety of projects is more refined
I was able to design a product that had been requested by people for a few years in a short amount of time

slicers-gui.name: Slicers GUI
slicers-gui.description: This is by far the project I am the most proud of. It is the culmination of a lot of work by both me and the SWTOR Slicers community, and the result is a truly unique piece of software that serves its purpose well. The idea behind making it was to optimize and improve all existing tools, and bundle them all into one cohesive, fully customizable application.

data.text: This is by far the project I am the most proud of. It is the culmination of a lot of work by both me and the SWTOR Slicers community, and the result is a truly unique piece of software that serves its purpose well. The idea behind making it was to optimize and improve all existing tools, and bundle them all into one cohesive, fully customizable application.

items.content: I wanted to make an application, because I had never done that before
I was sick of all the default C# UIs on the existing tools
I wanted to make improvements to a lot of the existing tools because they were not nearly as efficient as the could be
How to make apps using the Electron.js framework
The GO programming language
How to write native code and run it in process using Edge.js
How to take advantage of offloading tasks to web workers
How to effectively run a beta test and implement user feedback
How to create a good UX (user experience)
How to effectively pass data between different parts of an application, without compromising on performance

data.text: This is a long term project, so I am sure I will continue to learn from it

web-dev-intro-camp.name: SGIS Intro to web dev camp
web-dev-intro-camp.description: This project was a venture into an area I had absolutely no experience with, teaching. I had the idea to make the camp because my school gave me the opportunity to get into computer science, and I wanted to offer others that opportunity as well. I also saw the camp as a great way to solidify my understanding of web development.

data.text: This project was a venture into an area I had absolutely no experience with, teaching. I had the idea to make the camp because my school gave me the opportunity to get into computer science, and I wanted to offer others that opportunity as well. I also saw the camp as a great way to solidify my understanding of web development.

items.content: I wanted to give back to my school for giving me the chance to get into computer science
I wanted to give others the same chance I had to discover a passion and talent they didn't know they had.
I wanted to make sure I understood the fundamentals of web development before moving on to more advanced concepts
I solidified my understanding of the fundamentals of web development
I had the opportunity to share my love of programming with others, and inspire them to continue learning
I learned how to efficiently summarize and present data in a way people can comprehend

modbot.name: Discord Modbot
modbot.description: Modbot was a project I started after I had finished learning Java and was familiar with JavaScript and SpringBoot. This allowed me to make a more advanced project, as I already knew the foundations. For this project, I decided to split the Database from the Discord Bot. This meant that I needed to learn how to send Java to Java JSON data. I also made a frontend for users to interact with, which was my second web development project.

data.text: Modbot was a project I started after I had finished learning Java and was familiar with JavaScript and SpringBoot. This allowed me to make a more advanced project, as I already knew the foundations. For this project, I decided to split the Database from the Discord Bot. This meant that I needed to learn how to send Java to Java JSON data. I also made a frontend for users to interact with, which was my second web development project.

items.content: I wanted to make a very versatile and complexed discord bot, with oAuth, custom commands, and able to be tailored to a user's preferences
I wanted to practice more with SpringBoot, and learn some of its more advanced features
I wanted to practice web development
Learned the more advanced parts of SpringBoot
Learned how to structure HTTP requests in java, and decode JSONs in java using GSON
Was able to make a very advanced discord bot, that works reliably
Learned the basics of oAuth and good conventions to use when implementing it
The API (Application Programming Interface)
The Discord Bot (The actual bot itself)
The Front End UI (Allows users to tailor the bot to their specific needs)

memedb.name: The MemeDB
memedb.description: The memeDB was one of my first projects. I had finished AP Java a few months earlier, so I was still relatively new to programming. I read about SpringBoot (an API framework for Java), and immediately wanted to make my own. I decided that a fun and interesting idea would be to make a meme database, so I went with that. First I made an API with SpringBoot, and then a React.js front end. I later realized that React was not suited for my needs, as I wanted to make a multipage website, so I switched to normal JavaScript, HTML, and CSS. This was my first attempt at web development, and I enjoyed it a lot.

data.text: The memeDB was one of my first projects. I had finished AP Java a few months earlier, so I was still relatively new to programming. I read about SpringBoot (an API framework for Java), and immediately wanted to make my own. I decided that a fun and interesting idea would be to make a meme database, so I went with that. First I made an API with SpringBoot, and then a React.js front end. I later realized that React was not suited for my needs, as I wanted to make a multipage website, so I switched to normal JavaScript, HTML, and CSS. This was my first attempt at web development, and I enjoyed it a lot.

items.content: Wanted to try something new
Had just learned about SpringBoot, and wanted to learn the basics
Wanted to learn web development
Learned the basics of SpringBoot
Learned SQL
Finished my first web UI
The UI. It was a very simple UI as I was still learning, but I was satisfied with it.
The API (Application Programming Interface). This was the server hosting the database and API the UI communicated with and pulled from.

slicers-wiki.name: SWTOR Slicers Wiki
slicers-wiki.description: The SWTOR Slicers Wiki is a collection of guides that serve to help people through the various processes involved in data mining, extraction, and modding. It continues to grow as we add more and more tutorials, and serves as a one stop shop for all things SWTOR Slicers.

data.text: The SWTOR Slicers Wiki is a collection of guides that serve to help people through the various processes involved in data mining, extraction, and modding. It continues to grow as we add more and more tutorials, and serves as a one stop shop for all things SWTOR Slicers.

items.content: We wanted to have a better way to explain the ins and outs of our community (we previously just had pdfs)
I wanted to organize our guides into a more intuitive design, and provide a place to put documentation of our work.
We have a more organized way to present our guides, and a nice place to direct new people

slicers-blender-importer.name: Slicers Blender Importer
slicers-blender-importer.description: The blender importer was very different before I started making changes. I added multi file importing, as well as one click imports. The one click imports work with the TORC Character Designer and my Locator tool to import all models and materials for a given SWTOR character, allowing artists to get right to making art.

data.text: The blender importer was very different before I started making changes. I added multi file importing, as well as one click imports. The one click imports work with the TORC Character Designer and my Locator tool to import all models and materials for a given SWTOR character, allowing artists to get right to making art.

items.content: Wanted to help contribute to the organization
People had been asking for multi model importing for a while
I wanted to automate the last piece of the process, as I had already done the first two
Was able to meet people's requests for multi file importing
I was able to fully automate the importing process, taking a nearly 2 hour process and making it take 20 seconds

swtor-slicers.name: SWTOR Slicers
swtor-slicers.about: The SWTOR Slicers Collaboration is a group who enjoys taking Star Wars The Old Republic beyond the game. Whether this be through using models for fan films, or creating tools for the community (such as my Character and Outfit Designer), the community enjoys finding new and unique was to utilize the game.
swtor-slicers.description: I became a collaborator (essentially I work on new tools and techniques for the community, and help people whenever they have questions) because of my work on the Character and Outfit Designer. This was because I added a secondary feature to my tool, the ability to download a .zip file with all of the nessesary information to recreate the character in Blender. This, combined with a script I wrote to automatically locates all the models and textures, takes a process that used to take over 1 hour, and makes it take under 20 minutes. Since finishing that, I continue to help people, as well as work to make the process even easier.

torcommunity.name: TORCommunity.com
torcommunity.about: TORCommunity.com is a fan site for Star Wars The Old Republic. It was started in 2008, and has many neat features, such as guides, walkthroughs, tips, tools, and multiple databases. The sites goal is to provide great resources, and improve the experience players have while playing the game.
torcommunity.description: I got involved with TORCommunity after the owner and head dev of the site reached out to me while I was working on the Character and Outfit Designer and asked if I would be willing to put it up on TORCommunity. He had been looking for a tool just like it for the site for a while, and I was hoping to get it up on one of the fan sites as well. After finishing the app, and putting it up live on the site, he offered me the opportunity to continue working on the site, which I gladly took him up on. Since then, I have continued to work on the Character and Outfit Designer, as well as other parts of the site.

experience.name: Synergy Animal Behavior
experience.description: Created and managed client databases and resources for Synergy Animal Behavior as a summer job.

art.name: SWTOR Neon Sign
art.description: This piece is a 3D render of a neon sign inspired SWTOR (Star Wars The Old Republic) logo, made in blender. This was my first original piece.

art.name: Operative Neon Sign
art.description: This was my second attempt to make a neon sign using blender. It has a bit more detail then the previous one, and the pipes and corners are a bit cleaner.

art.name: Guardian Neon Sign
art.description: This piece was my third and most recent attemp at making a neon sign in blender. I was satisfied with how the previous sign turned out, however I wanted to add more detail. I settled on modeling a bracket, screws, and clips to 'hold' the sign to the brick wall behind, which turned out really nice.

art.name: Let the Wookie Win
art.description: If you are a Star Wars fan you may recognize the name of this piece. It was inspired by a scene from Star Wars IV: A New Hope.

art.name: The Gathering Storm
art.path: ./img/art pieces/Eye of the Gathering Storm Final.png
art.description: This is a piece inspired by artwork I saw online years ago. It is a sorcerer summoning a storm around himself.

art.name: Vaulthunter Neon
art.description: This piece is based on the vaulthunter's icon from borderlands 2. I tried making a more realistic brick wall, but the realism took away from the sign itself, so I reverted it back to the older material.
